conversations.description: User uploads 2023 bank statements and receives a breakdown of taxable income versus deductible expenses.
User provides a stack of grocery receipt images; TaxMate identifies and categorizes medical expense deductions.
Self‑employed freelancer uploads a 1099‑NEC and credit‑card statement; the assistant calculates quarterly estimated taxes.
User uploads mortgage interest statements; TaxMate applies the home‑mortgage deduction and updates the 1040 form.
Couple files jointly, upload both W‑2s and a charitable donation receipt; the system optimizes itemized deductions.
User requests the latest California tax credits; TaxMate fetches updates and shows eligibility for the earned income credit.
User uploads multiple years of bank CSVs; the assistant flags potential audit triggers and suggests corrective actions.
User asks for a tax filing extension; TaxMate prepares and e‑files Form 4868 with a payment plan suggestion.
Gig‑economy driver uploads ride‑share earnings CSV; TaxMate calculates mileage deduction and self‑employment tax.
User provides crypto exchange CSV; the assistant identifies capital gains, losses, and applies wash‑sale rules.
User uploads a receipt for a home office setup; TaxMate determines the simplified vs. actual expense method.
User wants to know if they qualify for the electric vehicle tax credit; TaxMate checks vehicle purchase documents.
User uploads a 2023 tax return PDF; TaxMate extracts prior year carryovers to adjust current year calculations.
User asks for a summary email of their filing; TaxMate generates a PDF, attaches the e‑file receipt, and emails it.
User uploads a medical expense receipt batch; the system aggregates over‑the‑threshold expenses for deduction.
User wants to split a large donation between multiple charities; TaxMate categorizes each receipt and totals the deduction.
User asks whether to take the standard deduction or itemize; TaxMate compares both options using uploaded data.
User uploads a 2023 W‑2 with multiple state withholdings; TaxMate prepares both federal and state returns.
User provides a rental property income CSV; TaxMate computes depreciation and schedules E for the rental.
User asks for guidance on education credits; TaxMate reviews uploaded 1098‑T forms and calculates the American Opportunity credit.
User uploads a large charitable donation check image; TaxMate verifies IRS limits based on AGI.
User wants to amend a prior year return; TaxMate retrieves the old filing, accepts correction documents, and submits an amended 1040X.
User uploads a series of business expense receipts; TaxMate auto‑categorizes for Schedule C and computes net profit.
User in New York asks about state-specific school tax credits; TaxMate fetches the latest NY rules and applies them.
User provides a paystub image; TaxMate extracts wages and pre‑tax deductions for accurate income reporting.
User wants to know the impact of a recent marriage on filing status; TaxMate re‑calculates tax liability for joint filing.
User uploads a 2023 health insurance 1095‑A; TaxMate determines eligibility for the Premium Tax Credit.
User asks for a forecast of tax refund after uploading all documents; TaxMate computes estimated refund before filing.
User uploads a donation of stock; TaxMate calculates fair market value, applicable limits, and needed Form 8949 entries.
User provides an old 1099‑INT and new interest statements; TaxMate consolidates interest income for Schedule B.
User wants to see a comparison of tax liabilities across five states; TaxMate runs the calculation for each state.
User uploads a receipt for a business conference; TaxMate verifies deductibility under travel expense rules.
User requests an audit trail PDF; TaxMate assembles a document list of all uploaded files and derived calculations.
User asks about the impact of a Roth IRA conversion; TaxMate models the taxable amount and future tax savings.
User uploads a foreign bank statement; TaxMate identifies foreign income and applies FATCA reporting requirements.
User in Texas wants to know about state tax obligations; TaxMate confirms no state income tax and suggests local filings.
User asks to set up a reminder for next year's tax deadline; TaxMate records the date and sends a calendar invite.
User uploads a receipt for a qualified energy‑efficient home improvement; TaxMate calculates the Residential Energy Credit.
User provides a list of dependents; TaxMate assesses eligibility for Child Tax Credit and Dependent Care Credit.
User uploads a 2023 Form 1099‑MISC for freelance work; TaxMate adds the income to Schedule C and estimates self‑employment tax.
User asks whether to elect to deduct tuition as an adjustment to income; TaxMate evaluates the Tuition and Fees deduction.
User provides a series of cash tip receipts; TaxMate aggregates tips for Schedule C reporting.
User wants to see how a charitable contribution of property affects AGI; TaxMate values the property and applies the deduction limits.
User uploads a recent property tax bill; TaxMate includes it in itemized deductions for Schedule A.
User asks for a quick filing estimate without uploading documents; TaxMate uses entered income figures to give a rough liability.
User provides a paystub showing pre‑tax retirement contributions; TaxMate adjusts taxable wages accordingly.
User wants a PDF copy of the completed 1040 before e‑filing; TaxMate generates the PDF and offers a preview.
User requests to add a spouse's W‑2 after initial upload; TaxMate updates the joint return and re‑calculates totals.
User asks about the impact of a student loan forgiveness on taxable income; TaxMate explains current legislation effects.
User uploads a donation receipt for a political campaign; TaxMate determines non‑deductibility and notes it for records.
User wants to know if a home equity loan interest is deductible; TaxMate reviews the loan purpose and applies limits.
User uploads an insurance claim payout statement; TaxMate treats it as taxable if it exceeds basis.
User asks for a step‑by‑step guide on how to sign the e‑file securely; TaxMate outlines the authentication process.
User uploads a small business expense receipt for office supplies; TaxMate categorizes it under supplies on Schedule C.
User requests a summary of all tax credits they qualify for; TaxMate compiles a list with estimated dollar values.
